channel.title: Hest
channel.itunes:author: Ivan Reese
channel.description: Ivan Reese thinks out loud about the design of his esoteric graphical programming system.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Ivan Reese thinks out loud about the design of his esoteric graphical programming system.

item.title: 1 • Graphical Programming
item.description: The term "visual programming" is a bit of a misnomer. My preference is "graphical programming", though it's hard to overcome cultural inertia. Oh, also, welcome to the show. Let's talk about Hest.

item.title: 2 • Why?
item.description: Why am I making Hest? Who is it for? When did I start? When will it end? What is it now? Where is it going? And what of this podcast?

item.title: 3 • Waterslide Kid
item.description: Functions and data, conveyance, points and edges, and execution with a mandatory, explicit notion of time and space.

item.title: 4 • Giant Thumb
item.description: Grab the giant thumb, push it all the way to infinity at the top, or negative infinity at the bottom.

item.title: 5 • The Space
item.description: Fully explore the space of your designs, even if it makes you into an infamous grump. Also, I sometimes make up jargon like Graphical Programming, and today we have another: Participatory Execution. Finally, Wallace & Gromit have their long-awaited debut on the show.

item.title: 6 • That's No Moon
item.description: Virtual edges and pocket dimensions might be key pieces of a workable approach to abstraction, something that Hest sorely lacks. The design process behind notions like "abstraction" requires deeply considering the tools offered to the author, so the back half of this episode is a lot of ranting about tools.
